references.paper_title: Deep unsupervised learning using nonequilibrium thermodynamics
references.reason: This paper is foundational for diffusion probabilistic models, a core concept underlying the current work.
This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models, directly inspiring the graph diffusion approach in this work.

references.paper_title: Generative modeling by estimating gradients of the data distribution
references.reason: This paper is highly influential in score-based generative modeling, which is closely related to diffusion models and forms the theoretical basis for this paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper extends score-based generative modeling to continuous time, which is a key element in the development of the continuous-time diffusion model proposed in this work.

references.paper_title: Digress: Discrete denoising diffusion for graph generation
references.reason: This is the state-of-the-art discrete-state diffusion model for graph generation; the current work builds upon this model by extending it to continuous time.
